review_title: Abusive Work Environment and Extremely Poor Management/ Supervision
job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Brookline, MA
pros: The salary is on the higher end and they will hire almost anyone due to constant staffing emergencies (in every department, SW included).
cons: Extremely abusive work environment, staff is physically assaulted, verbally assaulted and consistently attacked by patients who need a higher level of care but BHS will take anyone for the money without regard for protection or support of staff. Poor patient treatment, current staff members are constantly making reports to DMH for the lack of service and care the patients receive in an overcrowded, understaffed hospital. Upper management has no regard for employees and will make any decision that will get the hospital money (accepting COVID positive patients onto a floor without telling anyone, keeping units open with extremely low staff numbers and mandating every nurse they can). The Social Work department is poorly run and disrespected throughout all other domains within the hospital. The supervision is poor quality and extremely dismissive. There is no diversity amongst the social work staff and the employees of color who worked within the department during my employment were treated unfairly and used as a diversity check mark. I could not recommend a place of employment less. It is one of the worst facilities for patients to receive care and for clinicians to work, you will be putting your licensure on the line and will receive no support.

review_title: Bournewood:  Where dreams go to die and patients are an afterthought
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Brookline, MA
pros:
- Fantastic, broad experience if you're early in your career
- You get deep exposure to every aspect of social work, from working with insurance companies to individual therapy to group therapy to case management to lab tests and much more
- Works perfectly if you just got your LCSW
- Works best if you are a self-starter and can teach yourself
- You can grow a lot as clinician and therapist
- Wonderful clients
- Great colleagues
- Lovely support staff
- You can learn a lot working in partnership with the psychiatrists
- Just don't stay for more than 2 years or you will stagnate
cons:
- VERY old-school management philosophy fixated in the 1970s
- A culture that celebrates and rewards being a mindless robot
- Culture that punishes asking thoughtful questions, using critical thinking, or exploring how things could be made better. You will be beaten down for as long as it takes to crush your dreams.
- Zero investment in professional development or training
- It is a "bureaucracy-centric" organization, not a patient-centered one
- Command-and-control, hierarchal organization that beats the creativity out of clinicians
- Inept management. Many of the clinicians are brilliant, but they work for dim bulbs. You are never permitted to be more competent than your manager.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Brookline, MA
pros: Coworkers are great! Helpful and friendly in every sense of the word. You can have a great team of patients at the time and have nothing but positive interaction with them with groups, games and activities. Management will work with you...as long you fall in line.
cons:
Or you can have a draining, needy group that will make you question why you signed up in the first place. 

Codes are a huge safety concern, management expects you to be thrown into a potentially dangerous situation without the proper training for physical interventions or the means to properly protect yourself and when you do prevent a patient from harming you, you get frowned upon and put into question. 
The safety of the patients are top priority no doubt...how about your safety though? Willing to take the risk with a pat on the shoulder being told that management is sorry for the incident as they send you to the ER, only to be asked to come back to work immediately upon discharge of the ER because your shift hasn't ended yet. 
I can live without that
